title: MC_COORD_REF (Struct)
text:
TYPE MC_COORD_REF : STRUCT
Stores the position and orientation of the TCP.
The orientation is stored with three angles A, B, C according to
the ZYâZâ euler angles convention.
The new coordinate system is defined relative to the reference
coordinate system
Initially is identical with the reference coordinate system.
First, it is turned by A degrees around the z axis of the reference system.
Second, it is turned about B degrees around the resulting yâ axis.
Third, it is turned about C degrees around the resulting zââ axis.
The corresponding rotation matrix is given by R = Rz(A) * Ry(B) * Rz(C).
In this matrix, the columns correspond to the axes of the new coordinate
system, expressed in coordinates of the reference coordinate system.
Note
If A, B, C are computed by the system, the angle B is normalized
to the range 0Â° .. 180Â°.  If B is 0Â° or 180Â°, C is set to 0Â°.
